definitions.definition: A person who lives near a given place.
definitions.example: It's easy to tell the locals from the tourists.

definitions.definition: A branch of a nationwide organization such as a trade union.
definitions.example: I'm in the TWU, too. Local 6.

definitions.definition: A train that stops at all, or almost all, stations between its origin and destination, including very small ones.
definitions.example: The expresses skipped my station, so I had to take a local.

definitions.definition: One's nearest or regularly frequented public house or bar.
definitions.example: I got barred from my local, so I've started going all the way into town for a drink.
Functional programming languages usually don't allow changing the immediate value of locals once they've been initialized, unless they're explicitly marked as being mutable.

definitions.definition: An item of news relating to the place where the newspaper is published.
From or in a nearby location.
(of a variable or identifier) Having limited scope (either lexical or dynamic); only being accessible within a certain portion of a program.
(of a condition or state) Applying to each point in a space rather than the space as a whole.
Of or pertaining to a restricted part of an organism.
definitions.example: The patient didn't want to be sedated, so we applied only local anesthesia.
Hawaiian Pidgin is spoken by the local population.

definitions.definition: In the local area; within a city, state, country, etc.
definitions.example: It's never been more important to buy local.

definitions.definition: An anesthetic (anesthetic substance) that causes loss of sensation only to the area to which it is applied.
